remarks: The zero vector of vector space H has the zero translation as its first member and the zero trace-preserving endomorphism as the second. (Contributed by NM, 9-Mar-2014.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 24-Jun-2014.)
statement:

dvh0g.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` U ) $.
dvh0g.o $e |- O = ( f e. T |-> ( _I |` B ) ) $.
dvh0g $p |- ( ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) -> .0. = <. ( _I |` B ) , O >. ) $.
